meaningMnemonic: Remember how 身 can mean "animal flesh"? Well, when you <kanji>stab</kanji> some animal flesh and eat it raw, you're having <vocabulary>sashimi</vocabulary>. Yum!
readingMnemonic: The reading is a little weird. It's double kun'yomi where the 刺す becomes stem form and gets pushed inside the kanji to become さし. The 身 is just the word 身's reading.
